business.headline: Health insurance: 4 tips to reduce premiums for senior citizens Purchasing a health insurance policy at a younger age can help in securing reduced premium rates. Generally, lower insurance premiums are offered to younger people as they are considered low risk.

Index Funds vs. ETFs: 5 key things every investor should know Exchange-Traded Funds are traded like shares on the stock market and can be sold or purchased at existing market prices during the day, while Index Funds are traded only once at the closure of the share market.

ICMAI demands 'accountant' status for cost accountants in new Income Tax BillIn its memorandum, ICMAI highlighted the extensive training of Cost and Management Accountants (CMAs), which includes expertise in taxation, finance, auditing, corporate laws, and strategic risk management.

New tax regime: 3 deductions that can help taxpayers maximise savings  Though the new regime offered concessional tax rates, it reduced several popular deductions and exemptions, like HRA, LTA, interest on home loans, Section 80C, and more.

AI to take centre stage at the 3rd Digital News Publishers Association ConclaveThrough various keynote sessions, panel discussions and expert presentations, this year's DNPA Conclave aims to decode various critical issues, future strategies, opportunities and models that can power an equitable, inclusive and sustainable digital media ecosystem in an era of rapid technological advancement.
AMFI launches Chhoti SIP, Tarun Yojana, and MITRA. All you need to knowThe latest initiative by AMFI reinforces its goal of making mutual fund investments accessible to all investors across India.

Sensex, Nifty end lower for another session; auto stocks tumbleThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 424.90 points to 75,311.06 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 117.25 points to settle at 22,795.90.

Explained: What are 'high-conviction stocks' and why investors should track themHigh-conviction stocks are shares that investors, analysts, or fund managers strongly believe will deliver higher-than-average returns.

8th Pay Commission: When will it be formed? A look at the past trendsA Pay Commission recommends changes to the salary structure, allowances and benefits to be offered to employees depending upon the prevailing economic structure.

Explained: Why M&M share price tumbled 6% todayThe stock tumbled after the company said it will put money into a rights issue for its two subsidiaries—Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services (MMFSL) and Mahindra Lifespace Developers (MLDL).

Worried about volatile stock market? Check these 10 potential multibagger stocksThe most important factor for determining multibagger stocks is to check earnings and growth potential. Investors should seek stocks that consistently deliver revenue and profit, check metrics like PE ratio and dividend yield, and compare their performance with sectoral or broader market trends.

Planning to start SIP? 2 reasons why you should consider NPSBy investing in NPS, individuals can claim tax benefits of up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C and an additional Rs 50,000 under Section 80CCD (1B).

entertainment.headline: Rapper Diddy's attorney withdraws from case: Under no circumstances can I continueAnthony Ricco, representing Sean 'Diddy' Combs, has filed to withdraw from the federal case citing reasons protected by attorney-client privilege.

Buried Hearts review: Park Hyung-sik commands attention in his darkest roleReleased-Sat Feb 22, 2025The Korean drama Buried Hearts will captivate viewers with its blend of intense emotions and high-stakes drama. The series, featuring Park Hyung-sik, explores the complex dynamics of corporate intrigue and personal survival. Read the full review.

Rakhi Sawant reacts to summons: I'm poor, not criminal - focus on rape casesRakhi Sawant was summoned by the Maharashtra cyber cell to record her statement regarding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's controversial remarks on Samay Raina's show, 'India's Got Latent'. She urged the police to focus on solving pending rape cases instead of treating her like a criminal.

Zero Day: Critics praise Robert De Niro, criticise show's 'incoherent politics'Critics have mixed reactions to Robert De Niro's latest Netflix series, Zero Day. While many have praised De Niro, a section of them are unhappy with the narrative of the show.

Grammy-nominated band OneRepublic unites with Karan Aujla for new song Tell MeGlobal pop-rock sensation OneRepublic is collaborating with Punjabi artist Karan Aujla for a new track titled Tell Me. It will release on February 27.

Mismatched actor Prajakta Koli to marry boyfriend on February 25: ReportActor Prajakta Koli is set to marry her boyfriend Vrishank Khanal on February 25. Their wedding festivities will begin on February 23.

Crime Beat review: Rahul Bhat, Saqib Saleem's crime drama gets lost in its own chaosReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025'Crime Beat', a political thriller, premiered on Zee5 on February 21. Based on the book titled 'The Price You Pay', the show falls short due to outdated tropes and exaggerated clichés.

Honey Singh says he's a great cook, reveals his favourite dishRapper and music producer Yo Yo Honey Singh opens up about his favourite cuisine, his cooking skills and more in an exclusive interaction with us.

From heartfelt to hilarious, in praise of Park Bo-young's versatilityKorean star Park Bo-young has been acting for almost two decades now. Her ability to completely inhabit the skin of her characters makes her truly stand out. She is currently seen in Melo Movie, which is streaming on Netflix.

Honey Singh on his Mumbai concert: Doing something I've never done beforeRapper Honey Singh is starting his countrywide tour from Mumbai on Saturday. In an exclusive interview with us, the singer talked about the gig and what he's doing differently this time at 'Millionaire India Tour at Stage Aajtak'.

Kangana Ranaut's Emergency to premiere on Netflix. Check release dateKangana Ranaut's film, Emergency, is going to hit the screens next month. The actor shared a quick announcement in her Instagram stories on Friday.

Robin Tunney marks 10 years since The Mentalist finale, thanks fan for their loveActor Robin Tunney celebrated the 10th anniversary of The Mentalist finale, expressing gratitude to fans for their unwavering support. She also reflected on the show's impact on her life and career.

general news.headline: Operation Dunki: How Punjab's human smuggling rackets fuel illegal immigration As planeloads of Indian deportees arrived at Amritsar airport in Punjab, Indian Today's Special Investigation Team travelled to the key immigration hub of Jalandhar to expose a thriving human smuggling racket.
USAID and abet – Is US funding 'elections' in India?Between 2001 and 2024, USAID has disbursed a total of $2.9 billion to India. That's an average of $119 million annually.

Don't take me lightly: Eknath Shinde amid rift rumours with Devendra FadnavisEknath Shinde, who has been skipping meetings called by Devendra Fadnavis, asserted that he overturned the incumbent government when he was taken lightly in 2022.

Salman Rushdie attacker found guilty of attempted murder and assaultHadi Matar was found guilty of attempting to murder Salman Rushdie in a 2022 onstage stabbing. Rushdie suffered severe injuries, including blindness in one eye. Matar also faces federal terrorism charges in a separate trial.

Explained: What is Microsoft Majorana 1, how it works and what it means for youMicrosoft on Wednesday made a breakthrough announcement as it launched its first quantum processor, which unlike most other quantum chips that use electrons, the Majorana 1 chip uses Majorana particles.

No animosity among languages: PM amid New Education Policy tussle with Tamil NaduSpeaking at an event in New Delhi, PM Modi emphasised India's linguistic harmony amid a Centre-Tamil Nadu tussle over education reforms and the three-language policy.

Apple ends advanced end-to-end encryption in UK amid government pressureApple has announced that Advanced Data Protection, a feature providing end-to-end encryption for enhanced security across a wide range of user data, is no longer available for new users in the UK.

Deeply troubling: Government after Trump claims US election interference in IndiaIndia has raised serious concerns over US President Donald Trump's claim that USAID allocated $21 million to influence its elections, with the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) stating the matter is under examination by relevant authorities.

PM Modi says 'Chhaava ki dhoom machi hui hai' as he praises Vicky Kaushal filmPrime Minister Narendra Modi commended Vicky Kaushal's latest film, Chhaava, highlighting its widespread popularity. The film is about the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj.

LPU's 2025 Batch Final Year Student Bags Rs 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) Placement Package-Betireddy Naga Vamsi Reddy B. Tech student has secured a 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) package with an AI robotics company and is set to graduate in May 2025. 

-Over 1,700 students have received packages ranging from Rs 10 LPA – Rs 1 Crore per annum 

-1,912 students received multiple job offers while Adireddy Vasu, secured 7 job offers, setting a rare and impressive record.

Unacceptable: India slams Turkish President's Kashmir remarks during Pak visitDuring his recent visit to Pakistan, Recep Tayyip Erdogan remarked that the Kashmir issue should be addressed in accordance with UN resolutions through dialogue while considering the aspirations of the people of Kashmir.

Operation Dunki-2: Unveiling web of fake marriages, visas in immigration scamsIndia Today's Special Investigation Team found that there are a hundred ways for illegal migrants to enter the country of their dreams, as the travel agents and immigration consultants in Jalandhar and elsewhere have a loophole for every rule.

From Vogue shoot amid war to polls: Elon Musk makes Zelenskyy his punching bagElon Musk's barrage of attacks started with him sharing a 2022 cover photo of the fashion magazine Vogue featuring Zelenskyy and his wife during the Russia-Ukraine war.

IIT Kanpur says Arvind Kejriwal mention in exam was for academic purposeIIT Kanpur has responded to a viral exam question that mentioned Arvind Kejriwal. The institute clarified that the faculty member often uses well-known personalities, both real and fictional, to make questions more engaging for students.

When Partition turned two cricket giants and friends into on-field rivalsLala Amarnath and Fazal Mahmood, two cricketers who grew up playing cricket in Lahore, found themselves on opposite sides of history after India's Partition in 1947. Amarnath was a mentor and friend to Mahmood, and they were supposed to be part of Independent India's first international cricket tour. But history turned them into on-field rivals. While Amarnath captained India, Mahmood led Pakistan's bowling attack.

Watch: Tajinder Bagga calls Farah Khan 'biggest Chhapri' after her Holi commentTajinder Bagga criticised Farah Khan's remarks on Holi, calling her the 'biggest chhapri' for targeting Indian culture. He demanded an apology for her statement about the festival.

Watch: Ryan Rickelton gets out in bizarre fashion after maiden ODI hundredSouth Africa opener Ryan Rickelton got out in a bizarre fashion after scoring his hundred during Match 3 of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against Afghanistan in Karachi.

Sourav Ganguly predicts India vs Pakistan outcome, says spin will be king in DubaiIndia vs Pakistan: Former captain Sourav Ganguly said the defending champions might struggle against India in Dubai. Ganguly also backed Virat Kohli to overcome his struggles against spin.

Challenge accepted, says Annamalai, throws hashtag dare at Udhayanidhi StalinBJP Tamil Nadu President Annamalai challenged DMK's IT wing to a social media battle, asking them to tweet 'Get Out Modi' while he would post 'Get Out Stalin' at 6 am. His remarks came after Udhayanidhi Stalin warned that Prime Minister Modi would face such slogans if Hindi imposition continued.

Can new Uttarakhand land law balance local interests with economic growth?The stringent curbs proposed will resonate strongly with local people, who have long feared demographic and cultural threats from rampant land sales to 'outsiders'

CBSE Class 12 Physics paper: Tough multiple-choice questions, lengthy numericalsThe CBSE Class 12 Physics paper 2025 was moderate to tough, with tricky MCQs, lengthy numericals, and a few unexpected questions, making time management crucial for students.

Swara Bhasker clarifies Chhaava remark amid backlash: Don't misuse past glorySwara Bhasker faced criticism after her comments on the film Chhaava questioned societal priorities. She has since clarified her remarks, emphasising the importance of historical unity.

Aadar Jain, Alekha Advani get married in traditional Hindu ceremonyAlekha Advani and Aadar Jain had their Hindu wedding ceremony in a private ceremony at The Taj Mahal Palace in Mumbai. The couple, who had a white wedding in Goa in 2024, opted for an intimate affair attended by family and close friends.

Angela Bassett on losing Oscar to Jamie Lee Curtis: Thought I was deservingAngela Bassett shared her feelings after losing the Oscar for Best Supporting Actress to Jamie Lee Curtis at the 95th Academy Awards. Angela was nominated for her performance in Black Panther Wakanda Forever.

sports.headline: India might consider playing Varun Chakravarthy against Pakistan: Sunil GavaskarFormer India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar feels India might think about including wrist spinner into their playing XI for the blockbuster clash against Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Chakravarthy recently made his ODI debut in the second match against England.

Virat Kohli getting out to same type of bowling is a concern: Sunil GavaskarLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar said that Virat Kohli's continuous dismissals against spin are a concern for team India heading ahead into the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

WPL: Ellyse Perry's knock in vain as Mumbai Indians edge past RCB in thrillerEllyse Perry's 81 went in vain as Mumbai Indians edged past Royal Challengers Bengaluru in a last-over thriller at the Chinnaswamy stadium on Friday, February 21. Amanjot was the star of the show as she picked up 2 wickets and scored 34 runs to get her team home.

Steve Smith wants Australia to be 'switched on' from 1st game to end win-less runAustralia captain Steve Smith wants his men to be switched on as they begin their campaign in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against England in Lahore.

Champions Trophy: Ryan Rickelton, pacers annihilate Afghanistan in KarachiSouth Africa hammered Afghanistan by 107 runs in their opening fixture of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 in Karachi. Ryan Rickelton starred for South Africa with a century (103 off 106).

Australia vs England, all you need to know: Lahore pitch report, playing XIAustralia and England are all set to begin their campaign in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 as they take on each other on February 22 in Lahore. Both teams are coming on the back of series losses in recent times.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
